abroot.title: Immutable and Atomic
abroot.description: Vanilla OS is immutable and atomic Linux distribution. It is based on Ubuntu and uses ABRoot to provide atomic transactions.

apx.title: Sub-System Ready To Go
apx.description: Vanilla OS comes with Apx, a new package manager which install the software in an integrated container to prevent host compromise.

packages.title: Package Manager
packages.description: Choose one or more package managers to install

without_selection.message:
You have chosen not to install any package manager, you will only be able to install packages using the package manager (apx).

GNOME Software will be disabled since it is not compatible with the On-Demand Immutability.
without_selection.title: No package manager selected

preferences.title: Flatpak and Flathub
preferences.subtitle: Will also configure the Flathub repository.

preferences.title: Snap
preferences.subtitle: Uses the Snapcraft repository. Default in Ubuntu.

preferences.title: AppImage
preferences.subtitle: Will install the necessary dependencies to run AppImages.

commands:
!outRun echo '[Desktop Entry]
Type=Application
Exec=kgx -e bash -c "echo 'Configuring Flathub..' && flatpak remote-add --user --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo && rm -f ~/.config/autostart/flathub.desktop && echo 'Flathub installed successfully' || echo 'Failed installing Flathub. Are you connected to the internet?'"
Name=Flatpak Flathub
Comment=Add Flathub repository to Flatpak
' > ~/.config/autostart/flathub.desktop

nvidia.description: Choose whether to install proprietary NVIDIA drivers for better compatibility and performance.

info.title: About Proprietary Drivers
info.text:
A proprietary driver has private code that neither Vanilla OS nor Ubuntu developers can review.

Security and other updates are dependent on the driver vendor.

vm.title: Open VM Tools

info.text: Open VM Tools can be used in GNOME Boxes.
